data.title: GCSE Combined Science Revision
data.meta_description: Stars are formed from massive clouds of dust and gas in space.
data.text:
Galaxies are huge collections of stars like our Sun.

Our Sun belongs to a spiral galaxy called the Milky Way.

Astronomers estimate that the Milky Way is a collection of about 100 thousand million stars.

Our solar system lies in one of the Milky Wayâs four spiral arms, nearly two thirds of the way from the centre.
